memberdef.argsstring: (Vertex< Q, false > &Gamma_BSE, Vertex< Q, false > &Gamma_BSE_L, Vertex< Q, false > &Gamma_BSE_R, const State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda)
memberdef.name: compute_BSE

detaileddescription.para:
Insert the vertex of input "state" into the rhs of the (symmetrized) Bethe-Salpeter equation and compute the lhs.
Gamma_BSE
: Vertex computed as the lhs of the BSE
Gamma_BSE_L
: Vertex computed as the lhs of the BSE, with Ir on the left and full Gamma on the right
Gamma_BSE_R
: Vertex computed as the lhs of the BSE, with Ir on the right and full Gamma on the left
state_in
: Input state for which to check the BSE
Lambda
: Flow parameter Lambda at which input state was computed

memberdef.argsstring: (Vertex< Q, false > &Gamma_BSE, const State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda, const int it_Lambda)
memberdef.name: compute_BSE

detaileddescription.para:
Wrapper for the above function, with only the symmetrized result Gamma_BSE returned.
Gamma_BSE
: Vertex computed as the lhs of the BSE
state_in
: Input state for which to check the BSE
Lambda
: Flow parameter Lambda at which input state was computed

memberdef.argsstring: (const double Lambda, const Vertex< Q, false > &Gamma, const Propagator< Q > &G_bubble, const Propagator< Q > &G_loop, const fRG_config &config)
memberdef.name: compute_SDE_impl

detaileddescription.para: compute the (non-differentiated) SDE by forming a bubble in channel r --> 0.5*(B_r(Gamma_0, Gamma)+B_r(Gamma, Gamma_0)) and close the loop over the result

inbodydescription.para: make sure that integrand only contains K1r + K2r + K2br

memberdef.argsstring: (SelfEnergy< Q > &Sigma_SDE, const State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda, const fRG_config &config)
memberdef.name: compute_SDE_impl_v1

inbodydescription.para: prepare vertex Γ for computing 0.5 * [L_i( B_r(Γ_0, Γ_0 + γ_r) + B_r(Γ_0 + γ_r, Γ_0), G)] using compute_SDE_impl<channel>(...)

memberdef.argsstring: (SelfEnergy< Q > &Sigma_SDE, const State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda, const fRG_config &config)
memberdef.name: compute_SDE_v1

detaileddescription.para: compute the (non-differentiated) SDE by splitting up the full vertex in Γ = R + γ_a + γ_p + γ_t form the bubble in the 'natural' channels and close the loop accordingly i.e. Σ = L_0( B_a(Γ_0, Γ_0), G) + L_0( B_a(Γ_0, γ_a), G) + L_0( B_p(Γ_0, γ_p), G) + L_1( B_t(Γ_0, γ_t), G) where L_i stands for a loop with version i and B_r for a bubble in channel r (everything with non-differentiated full propagators G)

inbodydescription.para: Problem: To read out certain Keldysh components we use the transformations T1 and T2 (exchange symmetry) This switches between the channels a and t ==> We cannot split up the a- and the t-channel Rather, we would need to compute the intermediate bubble both in the a- and the t-channel In Matsubara the symmetry tables for the updown spin-component don't contain these transformations that transform between different channels
TODO(micro-optimization): write SDE in the way that Fabian likes:

Compute B(Gamma0, gamma_t)^upup directly and store it at the location where we actually store updown. Then let the loop read out the upup Komponent from this place. (There should be no issues with the symmetries.)

memberdef.argsstring: (SelfEnergy< Q > &Sigma_SDE, SelfEnergy< Q > &Sigma_SDE_a, SelfEnergy< Q > &Sigma_SDE_p, const State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda, const fRG_config &config)
memberdef.name: compute_SDE_impl_v2

detaileddescription.para:
Insert the self-energy of input "state" into the rhs of the (symmetrized) Schwinger-Dyson equation and compute the lhs. Original implementation of SDE corresponds to --> 0.5*[compute_SDE_impl('a', ...)+compute_SDE_impl('p', ...)]
Sigma_SDE
: Self-energy computed as the lhs of the BSE
Sigma_SDE_a
: self-energy computed from an a bubble (symmetrized w.r.t full vertex on the left/right)
Sigma_SDE_p
: self-energy computed from a p bubble (symmetrized w.r.t full vertex on the left/right)
state_in
: Input state for which to check the SDE
Lambda
: Flow parameter Lambda at which input state was computed

inbodydescription.para: alternative to below code (does the same stuff in more compact code):

memberdef.argsstring: (const Vertex< Q, false > &Gamma, double Lambda, const Propagator< Q > G_bubble, const fRG_config &config)
memberdef.name: check_selfconsistency_of_K1K2

memberdef.argsstring: (const char channel, const double Lambda, const Vertex< Q, is_differentiated_vertex > &Gamma, const Propagator< Q > &G_loop, const fRG_config &config)
memberdef.name: compute_SDE_impl_v3

briefdescription.para: Compute the SDE by closing the loop over K1a+K2a or K1p+K2p.

memberdef.argsstring: (SelfEnergy< Q > &Sigma_SDE, const State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda, const fRG_config &config)
memberdef.name: compute_SDE_v3

inbodydescription.para: Save results via a- and p-channel separately:

memberdef.argsstring: (SelfEnergy< Q > &Sigma_SDE, const State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda, const fRG_config &config)
memberdef.name: compute_SDE_v2

detaileddescription.para:
Wrapper for the above function, with only the total (symmetrized) result Sigma_SDE returned.
Sigma_SDE
: Self-energy computed as the lhs of the BSE
state_in
: Input state for which to check the SDE
Lambda
: Flow parameter Lambda at which input state was computed

memberdef.argsstring: (SelfEnergy< Q > &Sigma_SDE, const State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda, int version)
memberdef.name: compute_SDE

memberdef.argsstring: (const State< Q > &state_in, const Vertex< Q, true > &dGamma, const SelfEnergy< Q > &dSigma)
memberdef.name: compute_diff_SDE

memberdef.argsstring: (Vertex< Q, false > &chi, Vertex< Q, false > &chi_diff, const State< Q > &state, const double Lambda, const fRG_config &config)
memberdef.name: susceptibilities_postprocessing

detaileddescription.para:
Compute the susceptibilities chi_r in channel r from the full vertex, and the differences to the flowing susceptibilities (K1r of the input vertex).
chi_a
: Post-processed susceptibility in all three channels
chi_diff
: Differences between flowing and post-processed susceptibility in each channel
state
: Input state from which susceptibilities are computed
Lambda
: Flow parameter Lambda at which bubbles are evaluated

Parquet checks for the state in HDF5 file <filename>. For each Lambda step, compute vertex and self-energy by inserting the fRG result into the BSE/SDE and compare to the fRG results. Save norms of fRG/parquet results and differences as vectors into an HDF5 file, and also save the state object resulting from the parquet equations.

memberdef.argsstring: (State< Q > &state_out, const State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda, const int it_Lambda, const int version)
memberdef.name: parquet_iteration

detaileddescription.para:
One iteration of the parquet solver: Compute both the Bethe-Salpeter and the Schwinger-Dyson equation for given input.
state_out
: Lhs of the BSE and SDE.
state_in
: Input to the rhs of the BSE and SDE
Lambda
: Lambda value at which to compute the parquet equations

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string filename, State< Q > &state_in, const double Lambda, const int version, const double accuracy=1e-6, const int Nmax=6, const bool overwrite_old_results=true, const double mixing_ratio=1.0, const bool use_last_state_anyway=false)
memberdef.name: parquet_solver

detaileddescription.para:
Iterate the parquet equations for a given input state until convergence.
filename
: File name for result
state_in
: Input state used as initial input to the parquet equations (e.g. SOPT)
Lambda
: Lambda value at which to iterate the parquet equations
accuracy
: Desired relative accuracy used as convergence criterion for both vertex and selfenergy (default: 0.001)
Nmax
: Maximal number of parquet iterations, used as a break condition in case convergence cannot be reached (default: 50)
mixing_ratio
mixing ratio in [0.1 - 0.5] for stabilizing the parquet iteration

inbodydescription.para: mixing of old and new state:

memberdef.argsstring: (const fRG_config &config, const std::vector< double > &, int version, bool overwrite_old_results)
memberdef.name: run_parquet

detaileddescription.para:
Run the parquet solver, given a set of parameters.
config
Config struct which holds all necessary parameters
U_NRG_list
List of values for U/Δ for which to run a calculation
version
Version of the implementation of the Schwinger-Dyson equation to be used. Recommendation: 1
overwrite_old_results
Determines whether existing results for the given parameters shall be overwritten or not.
